info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:04PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Shelby and southeastern Jefferson Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 203 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Splash Adventure, or over Bessemer, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Birmingham, Hoover, Vestavia Hills, Alabaster, Bessemer, Homewood, Pelham, Mountain Brook, Helena, Hueytown, Fairfield, Pleasant Grove, Midfield, Brighton, Indian Springs Village, Lipscomb, Oak Mountain State Park, Bluff Park, Oak Mountain Amphitheater and Samford University. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
